intro: Choristylis rhamnoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed panicled grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale green to yellowish flowers. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Choristylis rhamnoides is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for native fauna.
